result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert C Schooler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must undergo domestic violence training. No contact with the victim unless approved by agent and victim. If there is any contact, it must not be violent. Must pay any child support obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert C Schooler

Defendant Robert C Schooler in court with attorney Brett A Ekes.  Defendant Robert C Schooler in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Parties have reviewed PSI. No additions or corrections noted by parties. State recommends 35 yrs WPS bifurcated as 20 yrs IC, 15 yrs ES.

BTC: Total sentence is 35 yrs WPS bifurcated as 20 yrs IC, 15 yrs ES/CFTS

costs

Defendant Robert C Schooler in court with attorney Brett A Ekes.  Defendant Robert C Schooler in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense files a motion to withdraw plea. Defense calls RS - DSAT. Direct by the Defense. The Court conducts a colloquy with the defendant regarding atty/client priviledge. BTC: The Court finds the defendant freely, knowingly, and voluntarily waives the attorney client priviledge. Cross xam by the State. The Court questions the defendant. Defense calls Gretchen Rosenke - DSAT. Direct by defense. Cross xam by the State.
Parties give argument

BTC: The motion of the defense to allow the defendant to withdraw his plea is denied. The State is to prepare an order. SEH to be scheduled  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of 11/5/15 Hearing to deft - Return to sender - Not deliverable as addressed; unable to forward.

In support of defendant's motion to withdraw plea.

ATTY Ekes files motion to withdraw plea.
Motion hearing on October 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on July 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Robert C Schooler in court with attorney Gretchen G. Rosenke.  Defendant Robert C Schooler in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer. TRANSCRIPT FILED 08-19-2015/tk
Defense is asking that the Court allow Ms. Rosenke to withdraw. The State indicates it is their position that the deft has not presented adequate facts that would allow him to have a hearing to withdraw his plea and therefore, Mr. Repischak objects to Ms. Rosenke withdrawing as counsel.

BTC: Ms. Rosenke may withdraw. Another attorney may be appointed.  Status conference scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Plaintiff's Brief in Response to Defendant's Motion to Withdraw Plea
Motion hearing on July 13, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
